intro: Pasania lanceifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf pasania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
